objective: Respond to PR #996 review comments from Gemini Code Assist regarding path traversal security concerns

workLog.details: Initialized Serena, read HANDOFF.md, loaded relevant memories for PR review workflow
Verified PR #996 not merged, retrieved 2 unaddressed review comments from gemini-code-assist[bot]
Updated all git worktree examples to use absolute paths (~/worktrees/) instead of relative paths (../) to comply with security style guide (CWE-22)
Single commit (1431ee7) addressing both review comments following batch response pattern
Posted replies to both review comments (2716271369, 2716271378) with commit reference and explanation
Marked both review threads as resolved (PRRT_kwDOQoWRls5qhUVY, PRRT_kwDOQoWRls5qhUVi)
Pushed commit to origin/feat/git-advanced-workflows. CI checks pending.

decisions.decision: Address both Gemini Code Assist security comments in single commit
decisions.rationale: Batch response pattern from pr-review-batch-response-pattern memory - cleaner history, efficient resolution

decisions.decision: Use absolute paths for worktree examples
decisions.rationale: While git worktree with ../ is technically safe, using ~/worktrees/ aligns with security-first AI training and repository style guide
alternatives: Challenge the security concern as false positive
